::: {.unit-reading}
# Reading

## Official Documentation

The definitive resource for Quarto is the [official documentation](https://quarto.org/docs), updated regularly with tutorials, examples, and an extensive feature reference. It is the go-to resource for comprehensive details about using Quarto effectively.

## Cheat Sheets

Quick-reference cheat sheets for Quarto can be found within the Positron IDE under *Help â€º Cheatsheets*, or downloaded from the [Quarto Cheat Sheet page](https://quarto.org/docs/quarto-cheatsheet.pdf). These sheets summarize essential commands, syntax, and best practices.

## Books and Articles

The following resources provide deeper insights into Quarto:

- [*Authoring Books with Quarto*](https://quarto.org/docs/books/): A detailed online guide for creating interactive and cross-referenced books using Quarto.
- [*Reproducible Data Science with Quarto*](https://quarto.org/docs/articles/reproducible-science.html): An article showcasing how Quarto supports reproducible research workflows.

## Community Support

Get rapid help and interact with the Quarto community via:

- The [`quarto` tag on Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/quarto)
- [Posit Community Quarto forum](https://community.rstudio.com/c/quarto/59)
- The `#quarto` channel on [Posit Discord](https://discord.gg/posit)

These platforms offer immediate help from community experts and developers.

## Example Galleries

Explore the [Quarto Examples Gallery](https://quarto.org/examples) for inspiration. Each example includes the source code, helping you learn practical usage and best practices by examining real-world applications of Quarto.

## Staying Up to Date

Stay informed about Quarto's updates, features, and improvements by regularly checking the [Release Notes](https://quarto.org/docs/releases/) or subscribing to the [RSS feed](https://quarto.org/docs/releases.xml).

::: 
<!-- end unit-reading div -->

::: {.unit-exercise}
# Practice

### Practice Exercise

Explore the official Quarto documentation and locate the information about customizing output formats. Bookmark or note down key sections.

### Substantial Exercise

Visit the Quarto Examples Gallery, select a detailed example relevant to your interests, and download its source code. Study and customize the example document by altering the parameters, content, or formatting. Render your customized version and submit your modified `.qmd` file, the rendered output, and a brief explanation of your modifications and learning experience.

::: 
<!-- end unit-exercise div -->
